conclusion: The problem involves determining how shadows A, B, C, and D change in position and size when the light source moves to the right above four objects.

There are four objects on a wooden surface casting shadows labeled A, B, C, and D: a plate with a strawberry cake, a rolled-up mat or carpet, a soccer ball, and a stack of cups with a postcard on top.
The light source is above the objects and moving to the right, requiring analysis of how this movement affects shadow position and size.
Basic principles of shadows: shadow position depends on the light source and object position, and shadows move in the opposite direction of the light source movement.
The size of the shadow depends on the distance between the light source and the object, as well as the angle of the light.
When the light source moves to the right, shadows should move to the left due to the opposite direction principle.
For the plate and strawberry cake (shadow A), if the light source moves to the right, shadow A should shift to the left.
For the rolled-up mat or carpet (shadow C), if the light source moves to the right, shadow C should shift to the left.
For the soccer ball (shadow B), if the light source moves to the right, shadow B should shift to the left.
For the stack of cups with a postcard on top (shadow D), if the light source moves to the right, shadow D should shift to the left.
All shadows (A, B, C, and D) will move to the left when the light source moves to the right.
